techniques.name: 22 Point Cover Drill with Kicks
techniques.description: Enhances the 14 point cover drill by incorporating defenses against various types of kicks, expanding the drill into a 22 point cover system. This section focuses on strategies for effectively defending against low line kicks, body kicks, head kicks, and teep kicks, utilizing checks, blocks, and evasive movements.

strategies.low_kick_defense: Involves checking the kick by lifting the leg at a 45-degree angle to intercept the kick with the shin.
strategies.body_kick_defense: Utilizes forearm and arm to block or absorb the impact of kicks aimed at the body.
strategies.head_kick_defense: Employs a combination of arm, forearm, and hand positioning to protect the head and neck from high kicks.
strategies.teep_kick_defense: Adopts an elbow cross block to defend against direct teep kicks.

techniques.description: A defensive maneuver to intercept low line kicks by opening the hip and lifting the leg at a 45-degree angle, using the shin to block.
Blocks mid-level kicks using the forearm and bicep to absorb and disperse the force of the kick while protecting vital areas.
Defends against high kicks by raising the arms to cover the head and neck, ensuring multiple points of contact to distribute the impact.
A specific block against teep kicks using the elbow to intercept and divert the kick away from the body.

key_points: Introduces a comprehensive defensive framework against various types of kicks, expanding the original 14 point cover drill.
Emphasizes the importance of proper body mechanics and positioning for effective kick defense, including the significance of opening the hip and lifting the leg for checks.
Highlights the use of blocks to defend against body and head kicks, advocating for a multi-point contact approach to efficiently absorb and redistribute force.
Incorporates specialized defenses like the elbow cross block for teep kicks, demonstrating adaptability to different attacking techniques.
Encourages creativity and adaptability within the drill, allowing practitioners to tailor defenses based on their style and the specific challenges they face.
